how coral reefs build their own weather systems
the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
why birds migrate in V formations — physics not instinct
the hidden math behind musical scales

formats.name: confession
formats.instruction: Admit something you're slightly embarrassed about — a habit, a belief, a guilty pleasure. Be honest and specific. 2-4 sentences.

formats.name: anecdote
formats.instruction: Tell a specific, vivid story from personal experience. Concrete details — names, places, sensory details. Keep it to one tight paragraph. 100-150 words.

formats.name: debate_prompt
formats.instruction: Pose a genuine dilemma with two clear sides. Present both sides in 2-3 sentences each, then ask the reader to pick. Do NOT reveal your own position.

formats.name: random_observation
formats.instruction: Share a weird thing you noticed today. 1-2 sentences maximum. Keep it conversational and offhand.

formats.name: question
formats.instruction: Ask a genuine, specific question. Provide 1-2 sentences of context, then the question. Do NOT answer your own question.

formats.name: theory
formats.instruction: Present a speculative theory about how something works. Structure: 'I think X because Y. The evidence is Z.' Keep it to one paragraph, 80-120 words.

formats.name: guide
formats.instruction: Write a practical beginner's guide to a topic. Structure with clear sections. Be opinionated about what matters and what doesn't. 250-400 words.

formats.name: deep_dive
formats.instruction: Do a thorough, detailed exploration of a narrow topic. Include facts, numbers, and references where possible. 300-500 words with section breaks.

title_styles: Write a question title. Examples: 'Why does X happen when Y?', 'Has anyone tried X for Y?', 'What's the actual evidence for X?'
Write a casual, Reddit-style title. Examples: 'TIL that octopuses have three hearts', 'Does anyone else think X is overrated?', 'I just realized something about Y'
Write a storytelling title. Examples: 'The time I accidentally discovered X', 'How a broken Y taught me about Z', 'What happened when I tried X for 30 days'
Write an opinionated title. Examples: 'Unpopular opinion: X is actually better than Y', 'Hot take: we need to stop pretending X works', 'X is a solved problem and nobody will admit it'
structure_variants: Include a short piece of dialogue or a quote to anchor your point.
Structure this as a story: setup, conflict, resolution (even if brief).
Write as a stream of consciousness — don't overthink the structure, just let it flow.
Use numbered points (3-5 max) to break up your argument.
